general.notifDisabled: Notifications are disabled. You will still see in-app approval dialogs.

system.engineFuture: Nexus will support alternative container runtimes in a future release.
system.resourceTotal: Total across all Nexus plugin containers. Refreshes every 5s.
system.cpuHint: Maximum CPU percentage for all plugin containers. Leave at 0 for no limit.
system.memoryHint: Maximum memory in megabytes for all plugin containers. Leave empty for no limit.
system.quotasApplied: Quotas are applied when containers are created or restarted.

mcp.gatewayDesc: Expose plugin tools to AI assistants like Claude Desktop via the Model Context Protocol.
mcp.desktopHint: Add this to your Claude Desktop config file.
mcp.codeHint: Run this in your terminal to register the MCP server.

securityTab.connectedClientsDesc: AI clients authorized to access Nexus via OAuth
securityTab.revokeDetail: All tokens will be invalidated. The client will need to re-authorize.

extensionsTab.extensionsDesc: Extensions run trusted code on the host and expose typed, validated operations to plugins. Plugins consume extensions through the Host API to perform privileged tasks like credential management and cache control.

updates.autoCheckDesc: How often Nexus checks for plugin and extension updates

keyChange.keyChangedDesc: The signing key for {{name}} has changed. This could indicate a compromised package or a legitimate key rotation by the author.

registries.title: Registries
registries.subtitle: Plugin sources for the marketplace
registries.name: Name
registries.localHint: Path to a registry directory with plugins/ and extensions/ YAML files
registries.remoteHint: URL to the raw index.json file of the registry

help.pluginStatusDesc: The colored dot next to each plugin in the sidebar indicates its current state. Plugin viewports are cached for instant switching and automatically unloaded after 5 minutes of inactivity to free memory.
help.extensionStatusDesc: Extensions are native host processes that provide operations to plugins. Clicking an extension in the sidebar opens its detail in Settings.
help.tip1: Hover over any plugin or extension in the sidebar to reveal a menu button with quick actions like start, stop, enable, disable, or remove.
help.tip2: The sidebar remembers your last-viewed plugin and settings tab across app restarts.
help.tip3: Plugin viewports stay cached in memory while you switch between tabs. After 5 minutes of inactivity, unused viewports are automatically unloaded.
help.runningLoadedDesc: Plugin is running and its UI is cached in memory. Switching to it is instant.
help.runningUnloadedDesc: Plugin is running but its UI is not in memory. Clicking it will load the interface, which may take a moment.
help.stoppedDesc: Plugin container is not running. Start it from the sidebar or the plugin viewport.
help.errorDesc: Plugin container encountered an error. Check the logs for details.
help.installingDesc: Plugin is being installed or its image is being pulled.
help.enabledDesc: Extension is running and available to plugins.
help.disabledDesc: Extension is installed but not running. Enable it from the sidebar or Settings.
